channel.title: b&w on Georgios Karamanis
channel.description: Recent content in b&w on Georgios Karamanis

item.title: Week 15
item.description: An impromptu photo shoot last Monday with Marius at Må bra massage. I’ve been a happy customer of his for many years and can’t recommend him highly enough.

item.title: Week 1
item.description: Another weekly photo journal, this year it is in black and white.

item.title: Week 12
item.description: Sunny days Exercises in minimalism and geometry Light and shadow play

item.title: Week 11
item.description: A trip to Stockholm Buildings Daily weirdness Cold shadows

item.title: Week 10
item.description: Snow looks nice in black and white Snow looks nice in color

item.title: Exercise 4
item.description: – Lorenzo De Rita, Alphabet of Assignments, The Photographer's Playbook, p. 81 The list of assignments in that page was more of an exercise in absurdity that the author made than a list of actual assignments. Examples are, “Demonstrate the validity of this emotional mathematics equation: 11+22=8”, “Do everything you can to do nothing”, etc. Anyway, I started collecting some question marks (one is greek):

item.title: Week 8
item.description: Baby stuff Running Minimal Black and white patterns Shadow on the wall Buildings

item.title: Week 7
item.description: Black and white is back. Trees, snow and red. Vomit.

item.title: Ghost town
item.description: I just “found” these long exposure photos from the summer. I like them.

item.title: Lines
item.description: [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="1500.0"]![ Milos, Greece ](/images/2016-11-11-201611827hvxk5g3bubferbjg4qbhcbrua4g/image-asset.jpeg) Milos, Greece [/caption]

Exactly ten years ago I moved to Sweden. This is the first ever photo I took here. I was fascinated by the warm colors of the buildings, but here is a black and white version. [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="1500.0"]![ Stockholm, Sweden ](/images/2016-10-10-2016101010/image-asset.jpeg) Stockholm, Sweden [/caption]

item.title: Rainy days are over
item.description: Just a few days ago I got my new camera, a Ricoh GRD IV. Here the first “test” shots.

item.title: Wide
item.description: Four photos taken with my iPhone in Uppsala, Sweden.

item.title: Kalamaria
item.description: Some photos from the streets of Kalamaria in Thessaloniki, Greece.

item.title: People in geometry
item.description: Niklas and I went for another photowalk yesterday. Uppsala, Sweden

item.title: Valborg
item.description: It wasn't only the cows that were celebrating on Valborg in Uppsala.

item.title: Around the station
item.description: Three weeks ago Niklas and I went for a photowalk around the Central Station in Uppsala.

item.title: Moving
item.description: Jogging, walking and cycling in Växjö, Sweden

item.title: Water Square
item.description: The Vattentorget (Water Square) by the lake in Växjö, Sweden. Sounds logical to me.

item.title: Under the bridge
item.description: Photos taken in Växjö, Sweden during the rainy day.

item.title: A rainy day in Växjö
item.description: They say bad weather is good weather in terms of photography. A month ago I was in Växjö, a beautiful city in south Sweden. The first day there was a rainy one and I definitely think that the “best” photos were taken during that day.

item.title: Demonstration
item.description: During the workshop and while we were outside Fotografiska, where Knut was talking about portraits, a demonstration took place right in front of our eyes.

item.title: Efthymios
item.description: My “homework” for the portrait workshop with Knut Koivisto.

item.title: Johan
item.description: On the first day of the portrait workshop, we had to take to take some photos of each other. Johan, a journalist and photographer (of course!), turned out to be a great model, too!

item.title: Portrait workshop with Knut Koivisto, day II
item.description: Some photos I took with my iPhone during the second day of the portrait workshop with Knut.

item.title: Portrait workshop with Knut Koivisto, day I
item.description: Last weekend I attended a portrait workshop with Knut Koivisto at Fotografiska in Stockholm. Here are some photos from the first day (click on the image to see next) .
